revisionDesc.change: moved notes to external notes file and added pts
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Minor correction on letter from Mary forwarded to Walt, from Gohdes.
Fixed notes on letter date Fanny Nostrand's expected death with reference to duk.00517
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Annotate aunt fanny, date, and revise impeachment and brown notes.
corrected date format in title; added call no., annotations

body.p: i thought i would just write a few lines and send you marysMary's letter it would be so long to wait till next week i dident didn't hardly know how to spare the envelope i have been looking over my stock and i find i have got three more i suppose you have got my letter to day in answer to yours of sunday Sunday last) i am feeling pretty well yesterday i dident didn't feel very well but to day i feel as well as usual poor aunt fanny all her savings and money will not avail her anything we had a real snow storm here this morning but it is cleared off now i have not heard from George since he went away so i suppose he is well and wont won't come now till the first of the month

we had a visit yesterday from mr Brown of portland ave Portland Ave. he was very clever looks about the same only better i think he has been out of work for a long time he says he has had some money from england England that he had expected for a long time and it come very acceptable and willy and charlee works) i have had no more word from matty or hannyHannah or any body but this of marys Mary's i dont know what i should doo do if it wasent wasn't for letters i read the trial in the stars paper i was glad Johnson was acquitted i think it was right i dont don't seem to have much to write Walter dear this time but if you get any thing from england England as you expected i want to see it if you get more than one

postscript.p: i hope you are well walter
